definition: value/(to be) worth/to happen to/to be on duty
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to patronize/to support/to praise/(Internet slang) to like (an online post on Facebook etc)

sentences.chinese: 他的优良品行值得称赞。

sentences.english: History abounds with great men worthy of adulation and emulation.
sentences.chinese: 历史上有很多值得称赞和效法的伟人。

sentences.english: They took a commendable anti-ageist policy to extremes.
sentences.chinese: 他们将反年龄歧视这一值得称赞的政策推向了极致。

sentences.english: It said its porfolio of brands continued to show commendable performance.
sentences.chinese: 它说，它的品牌组合继续显示出值得称赞的表现。

sentences.english: His action in rescuing the drowning child was most creditable.
sentences.chinese: 他抢救溺水孩子的行为是很值得称赞的。

sentences.english: The irony is that nothing is particularly great in the Palmetto State at the moment.
sentences.chinese: 讽刺的是这一刻的玲珑棕榈州没有什么是值得称赞的。

sentences.english: His painstaking to attain his goal in life is praiseworthy .
sentences.chinese: 他为实现人生目标所下的苦功是值得称赞的。

sentences.english: Karygiannis doesn't believe the Conservatives' record deserves praise.
sentences.chinese: 不过，詹嘉礼却不认为保守党的纪录值得称赞。

sentences.english: Obviously, this is done with high precision to compliment the set.
sentences.chinese: 很显然，这种高精度的做法值得称赞。

sentences.english: The action this government has taken against smoking has been very welcome and it deserves credit for that.
sentences.chinese: 政府对吸烟所采取的举措深得民心并值得称赞。

sentences.english: It does her credit that she managed not to get angry .
sentences.chinese: 她沉住气没发脾气，这是值得称赞的。

sentences.english: His aim is honorable and praiseworthy.
sentences.chinese: 他的目的是高尚的，值得称赞的。

sentences.english: Considering these two points, she is praiseworthy.
sentences.chinese: 从这两点来说她是值得称赞的。

definition: lit. a blemish does not obscure jade's luster/the pros outweigh the cons (idiom)
conforming with the norms of society
see 沒說的|没说的[mei2 shuo1 de5]
